Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.disjoint_set

Interface DisjointSetForest<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements stored in the disjoint set
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    UpTreeDisjointSetForest
    public interface DisjointSetForest<E>
    The Disjoint Set abstract data type represents disjoint (an element is contained in one and only one set) sets of elements. No duplicate elements are allowed. The Disjoint Set interface is based on a similar implementation of partition structures developed for use with the textbook: Data Structures and Algorithms in Java, Sixth Edition Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, and Michael H. Goldwasser John Wiley and Sons, 2014
    Author:
    Dr. King

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Position<E> find​(E element)
      Returns a reference to the position that identifies the disjoint set that contains the given element
      Position<E> makeSet​(E element)
      Creates a new disjoint set to store the given element, and returns a reference to the position that contains the given element
      void union​(Position<E> s, Position<E> t)
      Unions two disjoint sets together into a single disjoint set

    • Method Detail

      • makeSet

        Position<E> makeSet​(E element)
        Creates a new disjoint set to store the given element, and returns a reference to the position that contains the given element
        Parameters:
        element - the element that will be contained in the new disjoint set
        Returns:
        a reference to the position that contains the given element and represents the new disjoint set

      • find

        Position<E> find​(E element)
        Returns a reference to the position that identifies the disjoint set that contains the given element
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which to locate
        Returns:
        the position that identifies the disjoint set that contains the given element

      • union

        void union​(Position<E> s,
           Position<E> t)
        Unions two disjoint sets together into a single disjoint set
        Parameters:
        s - the position that identifies the first disjoint set for the union
        t - the position that identifies the second disjoint set for the union
